settings.heading: Specifications
settings.content:
Power: Ultra-efficient 1/3 HP compressor, consuming only 280W for optimal energy savings.

Temperature: Precisely cools water to a revitalizing 41 °F (5 °C) for the ultimate ice bath experience.

Weight: A lightweight 40lbs (18 kg), making it easy to transport and position.

Water pump: Built into the chiller

Filter: External filter


Dimensions: Measuring 12x12x13in (29x29x32cm), our chiller is designed for effortless mobility and placement.

Eco-friendly: Consumes a mere $0.5/day or 1.4 kWh per day (24-hour usage), reducing your energy costs.

Coating: Matte black corrosion resistant paint on a steel box & frame.

Indoor/Outdoor use: Both, the chiller can also be used outdoors, but we recommend covering it, so it doesn't get dirt, water etc. on it.

Plunge bath Specifications

Spacious Design: 32in (80 cm) diameter and 29in (72 cm) height for optimal comfort during use.
Ultra-lightweight: Weighs only 7lb (3 kg) for hassle-free relocation.

High Capacity: Holds up to 79gal (300L) for an immersive cold plunge experience.

Inclusive Sizing: Designed to accommodate users up to 6'9ft (2.1 m) in height.

settings.heading: Standard VS Premium
settings.content:
Compare our Standard and Premium chiller models to discover the ideal choice for your needs. The Premium chiller excels with its enhanced cooling capabilities, delivering twice the cooling speed of the Standard version, making it perfect for those residing in warmer climates with temperatures above 77 °F (25 °C).

Standard Chiller (1/3hp):

  • Perfect for beginners and recreational users.
  • Designed for medium to low-temperature climates.
  • Can cool water down to 41 °F (5 °C)
  • Weighs 39lbs (18 kg) with 280W cooling power for easy portability and setup.
  • Quick and consistent water temperature maintenance.
  • User-friendly controls for temperature adjustments.
  • Low noise operation for a peaceful cold plunge experience.

PREMIUM Chiller (1/2hp):

  • Ideal for professional athletes and those in hotter climates (above 77 °F/25 °C).
  • Enhanced cooling performance, lowering water temperature to an invigorating 39 °F (4 °C).
  • Rapid water cooling, reducing preparation time.
  • Weighs 55lbs (25 kg) with an increased 390W cooling power, while maintaining easy setup and portability.
  • Superior durability to withstand the demands of high-performance usage.
  • Low noise operation for a peaceful cold plunge experience.

settings.heading: Shipping Info
settings.content:
We ship Worldwide with USPS, UPS or FedEx.

Processing time: Our estimated order processing time is 2-5 days, which refers to the period between when you place your order and when your product is shipped. We sincerely appreciate your patience and support during this time.

See the average delivery times below:

USA & Canada: 4-8 business days

United Kingdom: 4-8 business days

Europe: 4-7 business days

Rest of the world: 5-10 business days

All orders are shipped from our USA & EU Warehouse centre. You'll receive tracking when your order ships out, usually within 2-5 days after the order is placed. Please note: that we cannot guarantee the delivery date and timeframe, since it's in the hands of FedEx & USPS, the times stated above and at checkout are estimates from the courier itself. We can therefore not issue refunds for shipping cost if the parcel is delayed, and we advise to contact the shipping company itself should you have claims.

settings.heading: Return policy
settings.content:
We want you to be completely satisfied with your purchase of our Deep Dive Wellness products. If for any reason you're not happy with your product, you can return it for a full refund within 30 days of purchase. Please note that you'll need to cover the cost of shipping the product back to us. For the Chiller, the estimated return cost is $40.

Once we receive your returned item at our warehouse, we will issue your refund within 5 business days.

Please reach out to us at support@deepdivewellness.com for further inquiries.

settings.heading:
Unlock the Power of Cold Water Therapy,

settings.text:
speaking of saving money, let's talk about the numbers. Assuming you take five ice baths per week, and each session requires around 10-20lbs of ice, you could be spending upwards of $60 per month on ice alone. But with The Chiller, you'll make back your investment in just six months. That's six months of hassle-free ice baths, without any of the added costs.

So why wait? Invest in The Chiller today and experience the convenience, cost-savings, and refreshing benefits of an ice bath whenever you want.
Join the 100,000+ deepdivewellness customers and experience the unparalleled benefits and rejuvenation of our exceptional cold plunge therapy

Our chiller is designed to cool your water down to an optimal 37 °F (3 °C) with ease, thanks to its powerful yet energy-efficient cooling system. And once the water is at the desired temperature, our thermostat kicks in, keeping it there with minimal power consumption.

But that's not all. The Chiller is more than just a money-saving device – it's a time-saving one too. No more running to the store for bags of ice or dealing with the hassle of melting ice. With The Chiller, you can have a refreshing and rejuvenating ice bath whenever you want, without any of the hassle.

settings.title: Find Out How Deep Dive Wellness is Improving Lives Through Cold Plunge

settings.question: What is a cold plunge bath?
settings.answer: A cold plunge bath is a shallow bath filled with cold water, typically used for the practice of cold water therapy or hydrotherapy.

settings.question: What are the benefits of cold plunge bathing?
settings.answer: Cold plunge bathing has been shown to provide benefits such as reduced pain, improved circulation, reduced stress, increased mental clarity, and improved immune function.

settings.question: Can I use a cold plunge bath outdoors?
settings.answer: Yes, you can use a cold plunge bath outdoors, but it is important to protect the tub from weather elements

settings.question: What temperature should the water be for a cold plunge bath?
settings.answer: The temperature of the water for a cold plunge bath typically ranges from 50-60°F.

settings.question: How long should I stay in the cold plunge bath?
settings.answer: The length of time you should stay in the cold plunge bath will depend on your individual tolerance. It is recommended to start with short durations (1-3 minutes) and gradually increase as your body becomes accustomed to the therapy.

settings.question: What should I do after a cold plunge bath?
settings.answer: After a cold plunge bath, it is recommended to warm up gradually by showering with warm water or covering yourself with warm blankets. It is also recommended to drink plenty of water to replace fluids lost during the therapy.

settings.question: What should I wear during a cold plunge bath?
settings.answer: It is recommended to wear a swimsuit or other appropriate clothing during a cold plunge bath.

settings.question: Can I use a cold plunge bath if I have sensitive skin?
settings.answer: Cold water therapy may not be appropriate for individuals with sensitive skin. It is always best to consult with a healthcare professional to determine if this therapy is right for you.

settings.question: How do I maintain my cold plunge bath?
settings.answer: It is important to keep your cold plunge bath clean and well-maintained to ensure the best possible experience and to prevent the growth of harmful bacteria. Regular cleaning and proper storage can help extend the life of your tub.

settings.question: Can I use a cold plunge bath outdoors?
settings.answer: Yes, you can use a cold plunge bath outdoors, but it is important to protect the tub from weather elements

settings.question: How long does it take  to cool the water?
settings.answer: The Deep Dive Wellness Water Chiller can cool water to the desired temperature in as little as 20–30 minutes, depending on the starting temperature and volume of water.

settings.question: Is the chiller going to increase my electricity bill?
settings.answer:
No! The power usage is just 280 watts, similar to your home freezer.

For example, with a room temperature of 77°F (25°C) and the chiller set at 46°F (8°C), it consumes about 1.4-1.8 kWh per day (every 24 hours). Considering the average kWh cost in the USA is $0.35, the daily electricity cost for running the Deep Dive Wellness Chiller 24/7 is approximately $0.6.

settings.question: How much will I save on ice by using the chiller?
settings.answer: Assuming 3 ice baths/week requiring 10-20lbs of ice, the chiller's cost is recouped in about 6-9 months. This makes it a wise financial and time-saving investment for your regular cold plunge sessions.

settings.question: How does the Water Chiller work?
settings.answer: The Deep Dive Wellness Water Chiller works by using a refrigeration system to cool the water inside the chiller.

settings.question: Does the water chiller come with a warranty?
settings.answer: Yes, the Deep Dive Wellness Water Chiller comes with a 1-year warranty from the date of purchase.

settings.question: How often should I clean the water filter?
settings.answer: We recommend cleaning the water filter attached to the chiller once a month.

settings.question: Will the salt interfere with the chiller?
settings.answer: We used titanium tube, so it is ok to use salt seawater.

settings.question: What's the suggested temperature for ice baths?
settings.answer: Start at 59°F (15°C) and gradually reduce the temperature. Keep the chiller at 46°F (8°C) or above to lower power usage. Optimal benefits occur below 59°F (15°C).

settings.question: How cold can the chiller make the water?
settings.answer: Indoors, with a 77°F (25°C) room temperature, the chiller can efficiently lower the plunge bath water temperature to 41°F (5°C).
